clinical_study.brief_title: Micro and Nanoplastics as a Biomarker of Exposure and Effect in Chronic Kidney Disease Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Micro and Nanoplastics as a Biomarker of Exposure and Effect in Chronic Kidney Disease

brief_summary.textblock: Micro and nanoplastics (MNPLs) effects on human heath is still preliminary. Chronic kidney disease (CKD) participants, specially does patients submitted to hemodialysis, is a population high exposed to plastics. The objective of our research is to be able to detect MNPLs on biological fluids of hemodialysis patients as well as their potential genotoxic and inmunological damage.

detailed_description.textblock:
The exponential increase in the production/use of plastic translates into a parallel increase of environmental plastic- waste that is continuously degraded into micro and nanoplastics (MNPLs). Information on the MNPLs' effects on human health is still preliminary and, furthermore, the limitations in current methodologies prevent accurate human exposure/risk assessment.
This observational study will obtain biological samples of hemodialysis Chronic Kidney disease (CKD) patients as a reference and vulnerable group of individuals high exposed to MNPLs and potentially more susceptible. This will allow the optimization of specific biomarkers of human MNPLs exposure and the characterization of biomarkers of early effect that allows an association among the exposure to MNPLs and effects on human health.

primary_outcome.measure: Biomonitoring study to detect the presence of MNPLs in biological fluids
primary_outcome.description: Micro and nanoplastic and/or derivatives, would be evaluated. Characterization of possible biomarkers of early biological effects on human health

primary_outcome.measure: Study of the effects of MNPLs on imme system
primary_outcome.description: Impact evaluation of MNPLs on transcriptome, secretome and inflammatory signalling and inflamasome activation. Investigating the effect of MNPLs on the function of the immune system in vivo and in high-risk individuals

primary_outcome.measure: Genotoxicity effects of exposure to MNPLs
primary_outcome.description: Genotoxic, chromosome damage evaluation and oxidative DNA damage will be analysed by the Comet assay and the micronucleus assay

intervention.intervention_name: Biomonitoring study to detect MNPLs in biological samples and study of their health effects
intervention.description: Determination of MNPLs levels, genotoxic damage and inmunological effects

study_pop.textblock: This project will study a minimum of 25 adult participants with chronic kidney disease, included in an haemodialysis programme. A control group (matched by gender, age and lifestyle with CKD participants) will be also included.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria for Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD):
- Participant submitted to hemodialysis for more than 3 months
- Between 18 and 70 yeard old
- Stable haemoglobin (more than 10 gr/dl)
- Absence of infectious disease at the date of sample collection and for a period of more than two weeks
- Absence of active neoplasia
- Stable vascular access
Inclusion Criteria for controls :
- Between 18 and 70 yeard old
- Absence of chronic kidney disease or dialysis treatment
- Absence of chronic pathology (including neoplasia)
- Absence of infectious disease at the date of sample collection and for a period of more than two weeks
- Spanich residence
Exclusion Criteria for CKD:
- Clinical instability
- Life expectancy of more than 12 months
- Coagulation system disorders
- Participation in other clinical study
- Pregnancy
- Unsigned informed consent
Exclusion criteria for controls:
- Participation in other clinical study
- Pregnancy
- Unsigned informed consent
